Class UsernameValidatorTest

java.lang.Object
UsernameValidatorTest
@TestMethodOrder(org.junit.jupiter.api.MethodOrderer.OrderAnnotation.class) public class UsernameValidatorTest extends Object
Unit tests for the UsernameValidator class.

This test class ensures that the validateUserName method functions correctly by verifying valid and invalid username inputs according to defined criteria.

Author:
Dhruv

  • Method Details

    • testEmptyUsername

      @Test @Order(1) public void testEmptyUsername()
      Tests the validateUserName method with an empty username. Expects an IllegalArgumentException to be thrown.

    • testTooShortUsername

      @Test @Order(2) public void testTooShortUsername()
      Tests the validateUserName method with a username that is too short. Expects an IllegalArgumentException to be thrown.

    • testTooLongUsername

      @Test @Order(3) public void testTooLongUsername()
      Tests the validateUserName method with a username that is too long. Expects an IllegalArgumentException to be thrown.

    • testInvalidCharacterInUsername

      @Test @Order(4) public void testInvalidCharacterInUsername()
      Tests the validateUserName method with a username containing invalid characters. Expects an IllegalArgumentException to be thrown.

    • testValidUsername

      @Test @Order(5) public void testValidUsername()
      Tests the validateUserName method with a valid username. Ensures no exception is thrown for a properly formatted username.
